item.title: Industrial Composite Indicators for India: A Frequency Approach
item.description:
This is a work in progress.

We are building upon our working paper, developing monthly coincident and leading composite indicators based on frequency bands by selecting a particular industrial cycle only when it exhibits desired properties in terms of co-movement and time displacement.

item.title: Monetary Policy Statements and Government Securities cycle
item.description:
This is a work in progress.

We are exploring whether monetary policy statements (sentiment analysis using BERT transformer) could move government securities (G-secs) rate with less open market operations. Indian policy rates had not remained low commensurately with the United States interest rates post-global financial crisis. The fact that India’s G-secs rate is not falling as expected remains an open puzzle that we are actively trying to solve.

item.title: Multiple Sourcing of Imported Intermediate Inputs
item.description:
This is a work in progress.

We are exploring why do manufacturing firms import intermediate inputs from multiple suppliers (even when the quality of the imported inputs remains the same)? Are they optimizing the hold-up problem, or are they diversifying risk? Is it dependent on the type of inputs they are importing? We found strong evidence of (product dependent) multiple sourcing even for small single-product firms from the Chinese Customs Data.
